page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: The Stagecoach is a bus run by the Cambridgeshire County Council. The firm has 10 buses covering 11 villages . It was set-up because the United Counties bus service moved to another place so the Stagecoach took over.The name Stagecoach was a public decision. It picks up children from primary and secondary schools. The prices vary. The drivers favourite day is Wednesday which is also the busiest because of the shopping trips which are arranged on that day. People can book the Stagecoach but it doesn't get booked much. It has the very important job of taking prescriptions and blood specimens from a local surgery. It also picks up parcels. It cost approximately Â£80 a day to run it. The bus runs once a day taking and returning.
